ratings.rComments: He cares about his students

Though there were assignments regularly and time is needed for understanding the knowledge, Ed is really nice, patient and kind. I enjoyed having his class though I spent much time doing its homeworks.

IB 100 second 8 weeks online with Ed Dole is miserable.  Ed Dole is the most mysterious man in the world. He thinks that everyone loves Biology as much as he does but they don't! This class is not for anyone who doesn't have a girlfriend that is a Bio major.
Horrible class, worst professor. Tons of HW and assignments, hard exams for online section. Avoid this gene class, it will hurt your gpa. Love Life, leave ed dole!

This class is horrible, the professor is insanely bad, the worst professor ever in my study. Avoid this class, it will spend you tons of time for a gene class. And the assignments and exams are hard for online sections, don't hurt you GPA! the worst class

He is the worst professor I have ever seen in this school. Believe me, don't take his online class to fulfill your gene requirement. He gives tons of hw and very hard assignments and exams. This is only a 100 level class, he thinks you are already pro in biology. This is awful for an intro class. I swear I ll not take any IB class after his class.

This class was horrible. i had SO much busy work. during lecture they randomly take attendance and all he does is show you links which is COMPLETELY pointless; you don't learn anything. Dole treats you like a 5th graders and this class is like you are back in middle school science again. AVOID!!

Way too much work for a gen ed class. LOTS of assignments that do not help on the exam. I wouldnt be bothered by this, except for the fact that the website he uses is extremely difficult to navigate. Additionally, he also posts assignments at random times that will sometimes be due in only a few days. There's an easier gen ed out there, kids

This class is ridiculous. WAY too much work for an INTRO TO BIO class. He doesn't seem to understand that. His design of the class is terrible. Website is useless, homework assignments are useless, lab material is useless and the book is useless. DO NOT take this if you're not a bio major, you will regret it, guaranteed.

He seems like a nice guy. Tests are not bad, he gives good review online. The main problem with the course that almost EVERYONE experiences is the ridiculous amount of homework assigned. It's at least 2-3 assignments per week, usually taking up to an hour to complete. His online moodle site is confusing. He really needs to limit the homework.
Awesome guy, the class was a great and pretty easy overview of biology, encouraged me to look into bio further and I wound up with a minor in ESES.

I took ib 100 for a gen ed and i soon realized i could have found a better option. the only good thing about the class is that there is a ton of extra credit (7%) but besides that the class is unorganized and his lectures are impossible to follow. i only got an A because my friend is a bio major and helped me. try to pick something else...

If you are looking at this class to meet a gen ed, pass on it. His lectures are boring and impossible to follow. The website he uses for the class is very complicated. He makes the class difficult for an 100 level course.
Great guy he is so nice and helpful.  He really cares about his students.
He breaks down Biology thoroughly when you don't undestand a topic. He's also very friendly

Super easy class. Sometimes unclear at times but if you can read the text book and study exactly what he tells you (he pretty much gives you the test!) you will do fine. No curve, but lots of e.c. opportunities.

This class is fairly easy but there's a LOT of busy work.  A lot of your grades depend on the TA.  Mine was pretty ridiculous in that I needed to state the obvious when explaining something on an assignment or I'd get marked off for it.  Random in-class assignments (often just signing your name) for points. Way too much work for a gen ed class.

Class was easy if you do the work. Ton and tons of busy work with assignments and such. I myself earned 6 percent of extra credit and earned my A. Study hard for exams and it will pay off. Overall really nice guy though.

Ed Dole is so nice. His lectures are mind numbingly dull, but attendance is pretty much a necessity. Random lecture activities to take attendance. Take-home Assignments every other week. Exams aren't too shabby. Overall, not a bad class, but those take-home assignments might drive you a tiny bit crazy. Oh and don't even bother buying the text book.

Ed Dole has been my favorite professor at u of i. He is a really nice guy who helps his students anyway possible. The class was very easy as long as you do the work- the homework was difficult but we usually covered majority of it in discussion so it wasn't too bad. Overall, he's an awesome professor.

IB101 is a very easy class. I had an A+ going into the final. Most of the information you will ever need is on his website and power points, but he does give easy in-class assignments to take attendance. Overall Dole is very helpful and seems like he truly cares about his students (which is rare here).

Ed is such a nice guy! I had him as my professor and my TA in the education section. He really explains things until you get it. He is the most helpful teacher I've had here and I highly recommend him. Not much homework to do and he offers a lot of easy extra credit. The tests are also extremely easy!

He is a really good teacher! He can be kind of boring during lecture and the homework is hard but the tests only cover main concepts-not specifics and he is so willing to help you in any way possible. You can also get a TON OF EXTRA CREDIT! I really recommend the class to get rid of a gen ed!

Ed Dole is a great professor.  He is very helpful outside of the classroom.  If you do not understand the homework, he will gladly help you.  Discussion sessions are sometimes tedious but are very helpful.  DO THE EXTRA CREDIT.  There is 6 percentage points possible, and the work is not too difficult.  He is very nice and helpful.

boring class. we think someone taught him how to make links recently and he took the idea and ran with it.  study objectives and do the extra credit.  homeworks are kinda hard sometimes and are worth nothing.

Lectures are very boring and there's a lot of busy work. The class itself isn't too difficult. Lecture notes are found online. If you study the lecture objectives, then you should do fine on the tests.
Boring lectures but useful notes.  Website is hard to find what he used in lecture on your own.  Lots of busy work.  Good discussion sections that clarify concepts.

Professor Dole was a great professor. He made very clear outlines of what we had to know for exams and posted them on the course website. The lectures are a bit boring, but Dole is very helpful outside of lectures. The biology textbook is never needed, and exams are all multiple choice. He doesn't give much HW either, so I recommend doing the EXCR.

Oh, Dole. Like your outdated, senile uncle trying to teach you biology. ALL OF THE NOTES FOR EACH LECTURE ARE ONLINE. Tons of busy work. If you work moderately hard, you should be able to get an A. LOTS of extra credit opportunities. In all, a decent class for the 4 credits (with lab).

He is really nice, and he will help you whenever you want to meet with him.  The class isn't too hard either, but if you have questions, you can go to the class website and post them, and he usually answers in a few hours.

Great for a science gen ed because it is not too challenging at all. For each lecture, there are lecture objectives. You really only need to study and know those for the exams. Dole is very accessible and helpful if you need him, and the discussion sessions are also very informative when you don't quite understand the lecture material.

The review sessions are definitely helpful, and I've received a lot of help through the Web Crossing board they have set up. Very boring class though, no matter who's lecturing ... I usually doze off in there, and I rarely sleep in any other class.
Make sure you go to the review sessions.  tests are pretty easy.
everything fort this class can be found on the internet.
No Comments

dole has a mustache, and maybe thats why he talks so muffled and monotone? but the class' website is really helpful for studying and understand the material. discussions are vital; often homework answers are given. not as easy as i expected. but a good choice for a sci gen ed.

Voice makes it very hard to pay attention. Make sure you have a good TA and be sure to go to lab or discussion classes. Concepts are more easilly explained there. Lecture notes are online and exam questions are taken from lecture objectives. If you study the lecture notes, you'll be fine.
good teacher but the class is harder then you think
His voice is sooo monotone, I can barely understand him.  He is boring by nature; he tries to make us understand, but its uneffective.  One of those teachers that you can live or live without.
similar to high school Bio.  easiest class i have taken at U of I.  good lectures, concise and to the point.
a little confusing to understand sometimes but very helpful.  Likes to do little skits at lecture, usually doesn't help explain the concept.
